definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
the sun sets over western hills (idiom); the day approaches its end/fig. time of decline/the end of an era/Sic transit gloria mundi
a gentle breeze comes with sunset (idiom)

sentences.english: The funny cunning agent uses his gum gun before aurora or after dusk.
sentences.chinese: 幽默靈巧的賽跑者在日出之前或日落之後使用膠皮槍。

sentences.english: Odysseus sets sail as soon as the sun goes down.
sentences.chinese: 奧德修斯集帆儘快在日落時分。

sentences.english: I went to the sofa to rest and imagine tomorrow's sunset.
sentences.chinese: 我坐到沙發上去休息，想象着明天的日落會是怎樣。

sentences.english: It is supposed to look like a sunset or sunrise with clouds over water.
sentences.chinese: 這幅畫作看起來就像是大海之上雲霧縈繞的日出日落。

sentences.english: At sundown, the strong cold wind has shifted from the southeast to the northwest.
sentences.chinese: 日落時分成，強有力的冷風由東南風轉爲西北風。

sentences.english: We chose steamed fish for cooking our rewards from sunset fishing.
sentences.chinese: 我們要了蒸魚，這可是我們在日落釣魚裏的戰利品。

sentences.english: It has a very good sunset-over-the-Mekong view.
sentences.chinese: 這也是一個非常美麗的湄公河上日落景色。

sentences.english: White cloud blue crystal, evening mans the sunset west Yang.
sentences.chinese: 白芒浮雲藍晶瑩，黃昏之日落西陽。

sentences.english: I watch the sunset forty-three times a day.
sentences.chinese: 我看日落四十一天三次。

sentences.english: Pay him his wages each day before sunset, because he is poor and is counting on it.
sentences.chinese: 要當日給他工價，不可等到日落。

sentences.english: Morning and sunset, the quater of the metropolitan where I live and work.
sentences.chinese: 朝旭和日落時分，我生活和工作的城市，窗外。

sentences.english: Watched sunset in Edinburgh with best friend.
sentences.chinese: 愛丁堡的日落，跟張夏一起看的。

sentences.english: The soldiers launched an attack upon the eny at sunset.
sentences.chinese: 戰士們在日落時對敵人發起了攻擊。

sentences.english: To talk about the beautiful sunset is to gild the lily.
sentences.chinese: 談論日落之美是多此一舉。

sentences.english: Orange sunset in Florida's Big Cypress National Preserve.
sentences.chinese: 橙色的日落在佛羅里達的大柏樹國家的保護區。

definition: the sun sets in the west (idiom)
in the evening/when night falls/towards evening/at night fall/at dusk
variant of 餘暉|余晖[yu2 hui1]
